meanings.definition: Causing or deserving strong dislike or hatred.
meanings.sent1: The abhorrent smell of rotten eggs made everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent2: The movie depicted the villain as an abhorrent character, making the audience despise him.
meanings.sent3: The abhorrent taste of the medicine made the child pretend to be a dragon spitting fire.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrent behavior of the bullies was like a dark cloud hanging over the school.
meanings.sent5: The abhorrent sight of the abandoned house sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.sent1: She had an abhorrent reaction to the slimy texture of the food.
meanings.sent2: The abhorrent expression on his face revealed his deep loathing for the idea.
meanings.sent3: The abhorrent feeling towards spiders made him jump at the sight of a tiny bug.
meanings.sent4: The abhorrent memories haunted her dreams like ghosts in the night.
meanings.sent5: The abhorrent sound of nails on a chalkboard made her cringe uncontrollably.
